wikipedia_page.main: Sir Nicholas Cosmo Bonsor, 4th Baronet, DL (born 9 December 1942) is a British Conservative politician.

response: In 1965, Hornchurch Urban District was abolished, and its former area, including North Ockendon, was transferred to Greater London and used to form the present-day London Borough of Havering. North Ockendon and Great Warley were to the east of the M25 motorway when it was constructed. In 1992, it was proposed that the part of Greater London to the east of the M25 should be transferred to Essex, with the Great Warley section north of the railway transferred to Brentwood and the North Ockendon section to the south transferred to Thurrock. The transfer of North Ockendon from London to Essex was strongly opposed, with Nicholas Bonsor MP stating that his constituents agreed it had "more affinity with Havering than with Thurrock"."Review of Greater London, The London Boroughs and the City of London – London Borough of Havering, Report No. 654", Local Government Boundary Commission for England, 5 March 1992. Retrieved via the WayBack Machine, 7 April 2019. Following the review the Great Warley section was transferred to Essex, but the North Ockendon part was not, leaving it the only part of Greater London to be outside the M25 motorway.

Minister of State for Foreign Affairs (United Kingdom)

response: *Sir Nicholas Bonsor, 4th Baronet; MP for Nantwich (1979–1983) and Upminster (1983–1997)

The Vimy Foundation is a charity focused on raising awareness of the role Canada played in World War I and the implications of Canada’s success in the Battle of Vimy Ridge on April 9, 1917. The Vimy Foundation was founded in 1996 by John Andrew Powell (son of Ray Edwin Powell), with support from Sir Nicholas Bonsor. Its office is located in Toronto, Canada.
